alert.note: Alert for Northeast Suffolk; Southeast Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued March 04 at 11:12AM EST until March 04 at 1:00PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...One to two feet of inundation above ground level in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Northeast Suffolk and Southeast Suffolk Counties. * WHEN...Until 1 PM EST this afternoon. * COASTAL IMPACTS...Widespread minor to moderate flooding of vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. Expect 1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. This will result in numerous road closures and cause widespread flooding of low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront. Vehicles parked in vulnerable areas near the waterfront will likely become flooded. Flooding will also extend inland from the waterfront along tidal rivers and bays, and heavy rain could exacerbate flooding problems in those areas. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...Breaking waves of 7 to 11 feet along the oceanfront will result in significant beach flooding and erosion. Scattered areas of dune base erosion is expected. The probability of washovers is low. Along the twin forks of Long Island, particularly Orient Point, breaking waves of 3 to 5 feet along open east and northeast facing shorelines will result in beach erosion, with wave splashover over dunes and bulkheads exacerbating flooding of shoreline roads and properties. Localized minor damage to shoreline structures is possible. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
